Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as wine (?).
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 9 (disintegrated end of line 2) see 55667
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393149) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393149)
